content.question: Who should I contact for help?
content.answer: For immediate support, call our 24/7 Service Desk at [Your Hotline Number]. You can also email support@l3networks.com — emails sent after business hours will be addressed the next business day.

content.question: How can I submit a service request?
content.answer: For urgent requests, call our Service Desk at [Your Hotline Number]. For non-urgent needs, email support@l3networks.com to automatically create a service ticket.

content.question: What are your support hours?
content.answer: We’re available 24/7. Regular weekday support runs from 6 AM to 10 PM (Mon-Fri), and weekend and after-hours support is available round the clock.

content.question: Do you offer onsite support?
content.answer: Yes, onsite support is included in our Managed IT Services Plans when remote solutions are not sufficient.

content.question: Can you support businesses with multiple locations?
content.answer: Absolutely. We specialize in supporting businesses with multiple offices and work seamlessly across all locations.

content.question: How do I log a ticket?
content.answer: Simply email support@l3networks.com to generate a ticket automatically. You can also call our Service Desk for immediate assistance.

content.question: What are your response times?
content.answer:
• High Priority (e.g., network/server down): Response within 30 minutes.
  • Medium Priority (e.g., impaired functionality): Response within 4 hours.
  • Low Priority (e.g., minor issues): Response within 24 hours.

content.question: What are the priority levels for support requests?
content.answer:
• High Priority: Network/server outages or major disruptions.
  • Medium Priority: Impaired functionality or issues affecting some users.
  • Low Priority: Minor issues that can be addressed by the next business day.

content.question: How can I track my ticket?
content.answer: Log in to our Customer Support Portal to check the status of your service requests. Contact us if you need portal access or credentials.

content.question: What is the escalation process?
content.answer: We offer a streamlined escalation process with 24/7 access to senior management to ensure timely resolution of critical issues.

content.question: Are there any charges for using the Service Desk?
content.answer: Our Confidence Plus Plan includes unlimited Service Desk access. Non-plan users can use it on a time-and-material basis.

content.question: What information should I provide when asking for assistance?
content.answer:
• Your name
  • Company name
  • Location
  • Contact number
  • A brief description of the issue

content.question: What is your onboarding process like?
content.answer: Our onboarding process ensures a seamless transition to our services, with regular Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs) to align with your goals.

content.question: Do you offer training services?
content.answer:
Yes, we provide training during onboarding and ongoing, including:
  • Security tips
  • Monthly webinars
  • Phishing and security awareness training

content.question: What are Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs)?
content.answer: QBRs are strategic planning meetings to align our services with your goals, review past performance, and plan for future success.

content.question: Can you work with our internal IT staff?
content.answer: Yes, we collaborate with internal IT teams, using clearly defined processes for seamless integration.

content.question: Where is your support center located?
content.answer: Our Network Operations Center (NOC) is based in Columbia, Maryland.

content.question: Do you follow industry standard practices?
content.answer: Yes, we use ITIL-based best practices for IT services and systems management to ensure reliability and efficiency.

content.question: How do you notify clients about maintenance?
content.answer: We communicate maintenance windows and outages in advance and coordinate with your team to minimize disruption.

content.question: Do you support third-party vendors?
content.answer: Yes, we manage vendor coordination, ensuring smooth resolution for systems like phones, cameras, and more.

content.question: Do you conduct disaster recovery (DR) testing?
content.answer: Yes, we recommend and perform annual or bi-annual DR tests based on your business needs.

content.question: Do you have liability and cybersecurity insurance?
content.answer: Yes, we carry liability and cybersecurity insurance. We can also recommend partners for additional coverage if needed.

content.question: Do you support Mac systems?
content.answer: Yes, we provide full support for Mac systems alongside other major platforms, ensuring compatibility and smooth performance.
